column4: White House nominates former Google exec Lee to head patent office
column5: WASHINGTON The White House on Thursday nominated Michelle Lee to be  director of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office  which the former Google executive has led on an acting basis since January.

column4: Google's revenue falls short despite curbing price declines
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc's revenue fell short of Wall Street's expectations as growth in Internet advertising slowed in the most-recent quarter  offsetting a modest improvement in ad pricing  sending its shares down about 3 percent.

column4: For tech firms  the cloud makes carbon curbs compulsory
column5: NEW YORK As mobile devices proliferate and big business turns to cloud computing to cut costs and improve efficiency  technology companies are facing a double challenge: powering energy-hungry data centers to expand the cloud while keeping carbon emissions from skyrocketing.

column4: FBI director warns new phone encryption could thwart probes
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. FBI Director James Comey on Thursday made his strongest comments yet about encryption features built into new cell phones by Google Inc  and Apple Inc   warning they could hurt law enforcement efforts to crack homicide and child exploitation cases.

column4: eBay  Wal-Mart warnings stir holiday sales concerns
column5: SAN FRANCISCO EBay Inc  on Wednesday joined Wal-Mart Stores Inc  in cutting its outlook for the all-important holiday season  suggesting that the fourth quarter may turn out to be weaker than some analysts predicted as recently as last week.

column4: EBay  Wal-Mart warnings stir holiday sales concerns
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 15 EBay Inc on Wednesday joined Wal-Mart Stores Inc in cutting its outlook for the all-important holiday season  suggesting that the fourth quarter may turn out to be weaker than some analysts predicted as recently as last week.

column4: UPDATE 3-Netflix's U.S. growth slows  shares plunge
column5: Oct 15 Netflix Inc signed up fewer video streaming subscribers than forecast for the quarter that ended in September as its U.S. growth slowed markedly  sending its shares plunging as much as 27 percent.

column4: Apple's new iPads sport modest upgrades but short on 'wow'
column5: CUPERTINO Calif. Apple Inc's  faster  slimmer iPads come with modest improvements  such as a fingerprint sensor  but some analysts say it offers few other features to wow consumers ahead of a holiday shopping season expected to be swamped by mobile devices. | Video

column4: New Apple iPad can switch wireless carriers with a touch
column5: WASHINGTON Apple's   new iPad Air 2  announced on Thursday  will allow subscribers to switch wireless carriers much more easily  by swiping an icon across the screen of the device.

column4: New Apple iPad can switch wireless carriers with a touch
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 16 Apple's  new iPad Air 2  announced on Thursday  will allow subscribers to switch wireless carriers much more easily  by swiping an icon across the screen of the device.

column5: CUPERTINO  Calif.  Oct 16 Apple Inc's  faster  slimmer iPads come with modest improvements  such as a fingerprint sensor  but some analysts say it offers few other features to wow consumers ahead of a holiday shopping season expected to be swamped by mobile devices.

column4: Apple's new iPad Air starts at $499
column5: CUPERTINO Calif. Apple Inc  said on Thursday its new iPad Air will go for $499  and the smaller iPad mini will sell for $399 and above. Pre-orders begin on Friday.

column4: Apple's new iPad Air starts at $499
column5: CUPERTINO  Calif.  Oct 16 Apple Inc  said on Thursday its new iPad Air will go for $499  and the smaller iPad mini will sell for $399 and above. Pre-orders begin on Friday.

column4: Apple Pay to launch on Monday  more banks signed on
column5: CUPERTINO  Calif.  Oct 16 Apple Inc's  new electronic payments service will launch on Monday  after the iPhone maker signed up another 500 banks to support a feature that competes with eBay Inc's PayPal and other online systems.

column4: Freezing women's eggs not risk-free or foolproof: UK fertility expert
column5: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Freezing a woman's eggs is neither risk-free nor foolproof  a British fertility expert said on Thursday  after Apple and Facebook said they would contribute to the cost of the procedure for female employees.

column4: Costco seeks China path that avoids Wal-Mart's potholes
column5: CHICAGO By selling directly to Chinese consumers on Alibaba's platform  a move announced Tuesday  Costco Wholesale Corp.  aims to employ local knowledge and a low-cost structure to avoid missteps that caused even the world's largest retailer  Wal-Mart Stores Inc.   to stumble.

column4: Blackstone profit misses  sees chance to put more cash to work
column5: Blackstone Group LP   the world's largest alternative asset manager  on Thursday reported lower-than-expected third-quarter earnings  but said it was well positioned to profit from market jitters and put more of its $42.3 billion in undrawn investor capital to work.

column4: Eagle Bulk Shipping cuts debt by 80 pct  shares skyrocket
column5: Oct 16 Eagle Bulk Shipping Inc's shares shot up to as much as $15.46 from 68 cents as the company cut its borrowings by about 80 percent after converting debt into equity under a financial restructuring program.

column5: Oct 16 Toymaker Mattel Inc reported a 21.5 percent fall in quarterly profit as demand for its billion-dollar brands  Barbie and Fisher-Price  slipped further.

column4: Getty fails to get injunction on Microsoft image widget
column5: NEW YORK Getty Images Inc [GETTY.UL] has failed to convince a federal judge to halt Microsoft Corp's  Bing Image Widget  which it said enabled massive copyright infringement  because the software company had already taken it down voluntarily.

column4: Getty fails to get injunction on Microsoft image widget
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 16 Getty Images Inc has failed to convince a federal judge to halt Microsoft Corp's  Bing Image Widget  which it said enabled massive copyright infringement  because the software company had already taken it down voluntarily.

column4: Office Depot to cut 1 100 jobs in Europe

column4: NYC Papa John's pizza franchisee sued for $2 million
column5: NEW YORK New York state's attorney general sued the owners of five Papa John's pizza restaurants in Manhattan on Thursday for about $2 million over claims that they had underpaid 400 delivery workers and shaved hours from their paychecks.

column4: Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant
column5: TORONTO Billionaire investor William Ackman turned up the heat on Allergan Inc. on Thursday when he accused the Botox maker’s board of misleading investors to fend off a hostile takeover bid from Valeant Pharmaceuticals.

column4: UPDATE 2-Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant

column4: Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant

column4: REFILE-BRIEF-Toshiba and United Technologies sign agreement to grow JV
column5: Oct 16 Oct 16 United Technologies Corp :  * Toshiba and United Technologies sign new agreement to grow joint venture  * United Technologies Corp-companies have set a target to accelerate growth and double the unit's $1.6 billion annual revenues by the next decade  * Says both parties will announce specific cooperation schemes during the first half of 2015  * Says deal will expand engineering and sales resources outside of Japan   * Says collaboration will focus on smart c

column4: Exclusive: Boeing eyes possible Chinook helicopter sale to Brazil
column5: WASHINGTON The Brazilian Army has expressed interest in buying a handful of Boeing Co  CH-47 Chinook helicopters  the company said on Wednesday  saying that it continued to view Brazil as an important partner for defense and commercial projects.

column4: UnitedHealth says medical use is low and likely to stay that way
column5: UnitedHealth Group Inc  said on Thursday that patients had used medical services at low rates in the third quarter  easing worries among investors that higher admissions reported by hospitals would cost insurers more than they planned.

column4: UPDATE 3-UnitedHealth says medical use is low and likely to stay that way
column5: Oct 16 UnitedHealth Group Inc said on Thursday that patients had used medical services at low rates in the third quarter  easing worries among investors that higher admissions reported by hospitals would cost insurers more than they planned.

column4: UnitedHealth says expects medical costs to remain low
column5: UnitedHealth Group Inc  said on Thursday that medical costs were lower than it anticipated during the third quarter and that it expects spending on healthcare to be at the low end of its expectations in 2015.

column4: UnitedHealth says expects medical costs to remain low
column5: Oct 16 UnitedHealth Group Inc said on Thursday that medical costs were lower than it anticipated during the third quarter and that it expects spending on healthcare to be at the low end of its expectations in 2015.

column4: BRIEF-UnitedHealth CEO says 2015 consensus estimates reflect company outlook
column5: * UnitedHealth CEO says 2015 consensus estimates "do a pretty good job" of reflecting company outlook

column4: UnitedHealth's third-quarter profit rises
column5: Oct 16 UnitedHealth Group Inc said on Thursday that its third-quarter net profit increased as customers continued to use medical services lightly  helping to keep the cost of covering patient claims down.

column4: Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant
column5: TORONTO Billionaire investor William Ackman turned up the heat on Allergan Inc. on Thursday when he accused the Botox maker’s board of misleading investors to fend off a hostile takeover bid from Valeant Pharmaceuticals.

column4: UPDATE 2-Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant
column5: TORONTO  Oct 16 Billionaire investor William Ackman turned up the heat on Allergan Inc. on Thursday when he accused the Botox maker's board of misleading investors to fend off a hostile takeover bid from Valeant Pharmaceuticals .

column4: Ackman: Lawyers have documents purported to show Allergan misled on Valeant
column5: TORONTO  Oct 16 Hedge fund manager Bill Ackman said on Thursday his lawyers have seen documents that he said show Allergan's board knowingly misled investors as part of a defensive strategy to stave off prospective buyer Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc.

column4: Costco seeks China path that avoids Wal-Mart's potholes
column5: CHICAGO By selling directly to Chinese consumers on Alibaba's platform  a move announced Tuesday  Costco Wholesale Corp.  aims to employ local knowledge and a low-cost structure to avoid missteps that caused even the world's largest retailer  Wal-Mart Stores Inc.   to stumble.

column4: RPT-EBay  Wal-Mart warnings stir holiday sales concerns
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 15 EBay Inc on Wednesday joined Wal-Mart Stores Inc in cutting its outlook for the all-important holiday season  suggesting that the fourth quarter may turn out to be weaker than some analysts predicted as recently as last week.

column4: Europe Factors to Watch-Shares set to halt sell-off; eyes on earnings
column5: PARIS  Oct 16 European stocks were set to rise on Thursday  taking a breather after the previous session's steep sell-off  as investors took comfort in corporate results from bellwethers such as pharma group Roche  and food giant Nestle.     Roche reaffirmed its full-year sales and profit targets after a strong performance by its new breast cancer drugs helped it beat expectations in the third quarter.      Food group Nestle posted sales that were roughly in line with analyst forecas

column4: Wal-Mart CEO vows to end minimum wage pay in future
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  plans to improve opportunities for its employees so that in the future there will no longer be a few thousand workers on its payroll making minimum wage  the chief executive of the world's top retailer said on Wednesday.

column4: eBay  Wal-Mart warnings stir holiday sales concerns
column5: SAN FRANCISCO EBay Inc  on Wednesday joined Wal-Mart Stores Inc  in cutting its outlook for the all-important holiday season  suggesting that the fourth quarter may turn out to be weaker than some analysts predicted as recently as last week.

column4: EBay  Wal-Mart warnings stir holiday sales concerns
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 15 EBay Inc on Wednesday joined Wal-Mart Stores Inc in cutting its outlook for the all-important holiday season  suggesting that the fourth quarter may turn out to be weaker than some analysts predicted as recently as last week.

column4: Exclusive: Wells Fargo to shut its 'dark pool' as demand falls
column5: NEW YORK Wells Fargo  is closing down its alternative trading system  or "dark pool " due to decreased customer demand  the company said on Thursday.

column4: Whiting's tab for Kodiak dips with oil prices  but risks remain
column5: WILLISTON  N.D.  Oct 16 While the recent slump in crude oil prices has fanned concern about the longevity of the U.S. shale boom  it's created a benefit of sorts for Whiting Petroleum Corp by lowering the price the North Dakota oil producer will pay for Kodiak Oil & Gas Inc.

column4: Motorhome maker Winnebago's average selling price falls
column5: Winnebago Industries Inc  reported a drop in its average selling price as the company sold more lower-priced motorhomes in the fourth quarter  sending its shares down as much as 7 percent to a 16-month low.

column4: UPDATE 2-Motorhome maker Winnebago's average selling price falls
column5: * Shares fall as much as 7 pct to 16-month low   (Adds executive  analyst comments; updates shares)

column4: REFILE-Motorhome maker Winnebago's profit jumps 22 pct
column5: Oct 16 Winnebago Industries Inc  the U.S. motorhome maker  reported a 22 percent jump in quarterly profit as motorhome deliveries rose 25 percent.
